required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Hydrocortisone Treatment of Cardiovascular Insufficiency in Term and Late Preterm Infants: A Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock: This trial will evaluate the effects of a 7-day course of hydrocortisone therapy on short-term morbidity, cardiovascular function, long-term neurodevelopment, and mortality in critically ill, term and late preterm infants diagnosed with cardiovascular insufficiency as defined by a need for inotrope therapy in the first 72 hours of age.

detailed_description.textblock:
Cardiovascular insufficiency is common and potentially life-threatening in critically ill term and late preterm newborns admitted to the newborn intensive care unit (NICU) in the first few days of age.
This study proposes to conduct a multicenter, randomized, masked, placebo-controlled trial within the Neonatal Research Network (NRN). This trial will evaluate the effects of a 7-day course of hydrocortisone therapy on short-term morbidity, cardiovascular function, long-term neurodevelopment, and mortality in critically ill, term and late preterm infants diagnosed with cardiovascular insufficiency as defined by a need for inotrope therapy in the first 72 hours of age.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Birth to 22-26 months corrected gestational age
primary_outcome.description: This is measured as Yes if an infant died between birth and 22-26 months corrected gestational age; Otherwise, No.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Neurodevelopmental Impairment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Birth to 22-26 months corrected gestational age
primary_outcome.description: This is measured as Yes if an any hearing impairment or visual impairment is noted, if non-normal gross motor function level is noted, any seizures have been noted, or if the cognitive, language, or motor scores of the Bayley III score are more than 1 standard deviation below the average; Otherwise, No.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Death or Neurodevelopmental Impairment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Birth to 22-26 months corrected gestational age
primary_outcome.description: A composite outcome that measures the occurrence of death or neurodevelomental impairment between birth and 22-26 months corrected gestational age.

secondary_outcome.description: This is measured as the number of days between birth and 60 days of life of mechanical ventialtion of laryngeal intubation.
The day of life at which full nipple feeds were reached between birth and 60 days of life. Full nipple feeds are defined as at least 120 mg/kg/day.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Need for Gastronomy Tube
secondary_outcome.description: This is measured as Yes if a gastronomy tube was placed anytime prior to final status between birth and 60 days of life; Otherwise, No
This is measured as the number of days between birth and 60 days of life that an infant was on oxygen in the hospital.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Need for Home Oxygen
secondary_outcome.description: This is measured as Yes if an infant was discharged to home while on oxygen between birth and 60 days of life; Otherwise, No.
This is measured as the number of days between birth and 60 days of life that an infant was in the hospital. Infants who died or transferred to another care facility were not included.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Renal Insufficiency
secondary_outcome.description: This is measured as Yes if an infant had renal insufficieny between birth and 60 days of life; Otherwise, No. Renal insufficiency is defined as creatinine less than 2 during 7 days after first treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Necrotizing Enterocolitis
secondary_outcome.description: This is measured as Yes if an infant necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC) between birth and 60 days of life; Otherwise, No. NEC could be proven with or without surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Need for ECMO Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: This is measured as Yes if an infant received ECMO treatment anytime between birth and 60 days of life; Otherwise, No. Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) is a treatment that uses a pump to circulate blood through an artificial lung back into the bloodstream of a very ill baby.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Inotrope Exposure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours prior to study drug administration through 3 days post study drug administration.
secondary_outcome.description: This is measured as Yes if an infant was receiving inotropes on the specific day after the initiation of study drug.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours prior to study drug administration through 3 days post study drug administration.
secondary_outcome.description: This is calculated as the number of days on inotropes starting 24 hours prior to initiation of study drug, during the 7-day study drug administration period, and for 3 days after the study drug.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug administration (7 days) through 3 days post study drug administration.
secondary_outcome.description: This is calculated as the maximum dose of all inotropes in the 10 days following the initiation of study drug administration. For the purposes of this calculation, dopamine and dobutamine doses were considered equivalent and 0.01 mcg/kg/min of epinephrine was equal to 5 mcg/kg/min of dopamine.

This is calculated as fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2), as a percentage, multiplied by the mean airway pressure divided by partial pressure of oxygen in arterial blood (PaO2), during study drug administration. A lower oxygenation index is better.
This is calculated as fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2), as a percentage, multiplied by the mean airway pressure during study drug administration. Higher score means more severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Fluid Boluses Given
secondary_outcome.description: This is measured as Yes if an infant received fluid boluses anytime before or during study drug administration between birth and 60 days of life; Otherwise, No.
The number of fluid boluses given per participant, if any, before or during study drug administration between birth and 60 days of life

arm_group.description: hydrocortisone (hydrocortisone sodium succinate, plain; will not have benzyl alcohol) given through intravenous line or by intramuscular injection if no intravenous line

intervention.description: • 7 day course of hydrocortisone (hydrocortisone sodium succinate, plain; will not have benzyl alcohol) given through intravenous line or by intramuscular injection if no intravenous line). 1 mg/kg loading dose x 1; 0.5 mg/kg q 6 hours x 12 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q 12 hours x 4 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q day x 1 dose
7 days of intravenous or intramuscular placebo (normal saline in equal volume) 1 mg/kg loading dose x 1; 0.5 mg/kg q 6 hours x 12 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q 12 hours x 4 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q day x 1 dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Gestational age greater than or equal to 34 weeks at birth
- Admitted to the center NICU by 48 hours of age
- Intubated and mechanically ventilated for a minimum of 2 hours before 72 hours postnatal age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Receiving ECMO
- Intubated for the sole purpose of anticipated surgery or airway anomalies
- Treatment will be limited based on poor prognosis
- Receiving dexamethasone or hydrocortisone
- Receiving ibuprofen or indomethacin
- Congenital heart disease
- Hypotension thought to result from specific, immediately remediable factors including placental hemorrhage, acute hemorrhage or tension pneumothorax
- Pituitary hypoplasia or congenital adrenal hyperplasia
- Any chromosomal disorder
- Hypertension in the absence of inotrope therapy as defined by mean arterial blood pressure > 95th percentile
- Initiation of whole body cooling for moderate or severe neonatal encephalopathy
- Brain disorders or any other known structural abnormality
- Major anomalies

overall_official.affiliation: Case Western Reserve University, Rainbow Babies and Children's Hospital
Brown University, Women & Infants Hospital of Rhode Island

Michele C Walsh, MD Study Principal Investigator Case Western Reserve University, Rainbow Babies and Children's Hospital Seetha Shankaran, MD Study Principal Investigator Wayne State University Abbot R Laptook, MD Study Principal Investigator Brown Un

University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Infants < 48 hours of age and born at ≥ 34 weeks gestational age were screened for the study between June 2014 and July 2015 at the 16 NRN Clinical Centers. Those who were intubated and on mechanical ventilation for at least 2 hours within the first 72 hours were considered for the study.

group.title: Hydrocortisone
group.description: hydrocortisone (hydrocortisone sodium succinate, plain; will not have benzyl alcohol) given through intravenous line or by intramuscular injection if no intravenous line Hydrocortisone: • 7 day course of hydrocortisone (hydrocortisone sodium succinate, plain; will not have benzyl alcohol) given through intravenous line or by intramuscular injection if no intravenous line). 1 mg/kg loading dose x 1; 0.5 mg/kg q 6 hours x 12 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q 12 hours x 4 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q day x 1 dose

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Saline placebo Placebo: 7 days of intravenous or intramuscular placebo (normal saline in equal volume) 1 mg/kg loading dose x 1; 0.5 mg/kg q 6 hours x 12 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q 12 hours x 4 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q day x 1 dose

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Age refers to the infant and is measured as gestational age in weeks.

measure.title: Apgar score less than 3 at 1 minute
measure.description: The Apgar score is determined by evaluating the newborn baby on five simple criteria on a scale from zero to two, then summing up the five values thus obtained. Total Apgar scores range from 0 to 10. This measure is calculated at 1 minute after birth as Yes if total Apgar is less than 3. No, otherwise.

measure.title: Apgar score less than 3 at 5 minutes
measure.description: The Apgar score is determined by evaluating the newborn baby on five simple criteria on a scale from zero to two, then summing up the five values thus obtained. Total Apgar scores range from 0 to 10. This measure is calculated at 5 minutes after birth as Yes if total Apgar is less than 3. No, otherwise.

measure.title: Apgar score less than 3 at 10 minutes
measure.description: The Apgar score is determined by evaluating the newborn baby on five simple criteria on a scale from zero to two, then summing up the five values thus obtained. Total Apgar scores range from 0 to 10. This measure is calculated at 10 minutes after birth as Yes if total Apgar is less than 3. No, otherwise.

measure.title: Oxygen
measure.description: Collected during Resuscitation at Delivery

measure.title: Bagging and Mask
measure.description: Collected during Resuscitation at Delivery

measure.title: Chest Compression
measure.description: Collected during Resuscitation at Delivery

measure.title: Intubation

measure.title: Medications or volume expanders
measure.description: Collected during Resuscitation at Delivery

measure.title: Maternal gravida
measure.description: The number of confirmed pregnancies.

measure.title: Maternal parity
measure.description: The number of pregnancies reaching 20 weeks and 0 days of gestation or beyond, regardless of the number of fetuses or outcomes, including this delivery.

outcome.title: Days to Full Feeds
outcome.description: The day of life at which full nipple feeds were reached between birth and 60 days of life. Full nipple feeds are defined as at least 120 mg/kg/day.
outcome.population: The analysis population includes all randomized infants recruited from critically ill, term and late preterm infants diagnosed with cardiovascular insufficiency as defined by a need for inotrope therapy in the first 72 hours of age. Excludes 4 infants (Hydrocortisone: 1, Placebo: 3) without information on full feeds.

group.title: Hydrocortisone
group.description: Hydrocortisone: 7 day course of hydrocortisone (hydrocortisone sodium succinate, plain; will not have benzyl alcohol) given through intravenous line or by intramuscular injection if no intravenous line). 1 mg/kg loading dose x 1; 0.5 mg/kg q 6 hours x 12 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q 12 hours x 4 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q day x 1 dose

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Saline placebo: 7 days of intravenous or intramuscular placebo (normal saline in equal volume) 1 mg/kg loading dose x 1; 0.5 mg/kg q 6 hours x 12 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q 12 hours x 4 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q day x 1 dose

measure.title: Number of Participants With Inotrope Exposure
measure.description: This is measured as Yes if an infant was receiving inotropes on the specific day after the initiation of study drug.
measure.population: The analysis population includes all randomized infants recruited from critically ill, term and late preterm infants diagnosed with cardiovascular insufficiency as defined by a need for inotrope therapy in the first 72 hours of age.

outcome.title: Inotrope Duration
outcome.description: This is calculated as the number of days on inotropes starting 24 hours prior to initiation of study drug, during the 7-day study drug administration period, and for 3 days after the study drug.
outcome.time_frame: 24 hours prior to study drug administration through 3 days post study drug administration.
outcome.population: The analysis population includes all randomized infants recruited from critically ill, term and late preterm infants diagnosed with cardiovascular insufficiency as defined by a need for inotrope therapy in the first 72 hours of age.

group.title: Hydrocortisone
group.description: Hydrocortisone: 7 day course of hydrocortisone (hydrocortisone sodium succinate, plain; will not have benzyl alcohol) given through intravenous line or by intramuscular injection if no intravenous line). 1 mg/kg loading dose x 1; 0.5 mg/kg q 6 hours x 12 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q 12 hours x 4 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q day x 1 dose

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Saline placebo: 7 days of intravenous or intramuscular placebo (normal saline in equal volume) 1 mg/kg loading dose x 1; 0.5 mg/kg q 6 hours x 12 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q 12 hours x 4 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q day x 1 dose

measure.title: Inotrope Duration
measure.description: This is calculated as the number of days on inotropes starting 24 hours prior to initiation of study drug, during the 7-day study drug administration period, and for 3 days after the study drug.
measure.population: The analysis population includes all randomized infants recruited from critically ill, term and late preterm infants diagnosed with cardiovascular insufficiency as defined by a need for inotrope therapy in the first 72 hours of age.

outcome.title: Maximum Inotrope Dose
outcome.description: This is calculated as the maximum dose of all inotropes in the 10 days following the initiation of study drug administration. For the purposes of this calculation, dopamine and dobutamine doses were considered equivalent and 0.01 mcg/kg/min of epinephrine was equal to 5 mcg/kg/min of dopamine.
outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug administration (7 days) through 3 days post study drug administration.
outcome.population: The analysis population includes all randomized infants recruited from critically ill, term and late preterm infants diagnosed with cardiovascular insufficiency as defined by a need for inotrope therapy in the first 72 hours of age.

group.title: Hydrocortisone
group.description: Hydrocortisone: 7 day course of hydrocortisone (hydrocortisone sodium succinate, plain; will not have benzyl alcohol) given through intravenous line or by intramuscular injection if no intravenous line). 1 mg/kg loading dose x 1; 0.5 mg/kg q 6 hours x 12 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q 12 hours x 4 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q day x 1 dose

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Saline placebo: 7 days of intravenous or intramuscular placebo (normal saline in equal volume) 1 mg/kg loading dose x 1; 0.5 mg/kg q 6 hours x 12 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q 12 hours x 4 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q day x 1 dose

measure.title: Maximum Inotrope Dose
measure.description: This is calculated as the maximum dose of all inotropes in the 10 days following the initiation of study drug administration. For the purposes of this calculation, dopamine and dobutamine doses were considered equivalent and 0.01 mcg/kg/min of epinephrine was equal to 5 mcg/kg/min of dopamine.
measure.population: The analysis population includes all randomized infants recruited from critically ill, term and late preterm infants diagnosed with cardiovascular insufficiency as defined by a need for inotrope therapy in the first 72 hours of age.

outcome.title: Oxygenation Index
outcome.description: This is calculated as fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2), as a percentage, multiplied by the mean airway pressure divided by partial pressure of oxygen in arterial blood (PaO2), during study drug administration. A lower oxygenation index is better.
outcome.population: The analysis population includes all randomized infants recruited from critically ill, term and late preterm infants diagnosed with cardiovascular insufficiency as defined by a need for inotrope therapy in the first 72 hours of age.

group.title: Hydrocortisone
group.description: Hydrocortisone: 7 day course of hydrocortisone (hydrocortisone sodium succinate, plain; will not have benzyl alcohol) given through intravenous line or by intramuscular injection if no intravenous line). 1 mg/kg loading dose x 1; 0.5 mg/kg q 6 hours x 12 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q 12 hours x 4 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q day x 1 dose

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Saline placebo: 7 days of intravenous or intramuscular placebo (normal saline in equal volume) 1 mg/kg loading dose x 1; 0.5 mg/kg q 6 hours x 12 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q 12 hours x 4 doses; 0.5 mg/kg q day x 1 dose

measure.title: Oxygenation Index
measure.description: This is calculated as fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2), as a percentage, multiplied by the mean airway pressure divided by partial pressure of oxygen in arterial blood (PaO2), during study drug administration. A lower oxygenation index is better.
measure.population: The analysis population includes all randomized infants recruited from critically ill, term and late preterm infants diagnosed with cardiovascular insufficiency as defined by a need for inotrope therapy in the first 72 hours of age.

outcome.title: Respiratory Severity
outcome.description: This is calculated as fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2), as a percentage, multiplied by the mean airway pressure during study drug administration. Higher score means more severe.
outcome.population: The analysis population includes all randomized infants recruited from critically ill, term and late preterm infants diagnosed with cardiovascular insufficiency as defined by a need for inotrope therapy in the first 72 hours of age.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Fluid Boluses Given
outcome.description: This is measured as Yes if an infant received fluid boluses anytime before or during study drug administration between birth and 60 days of life; Otherwise, No.
outcome.population: The analysis population includes all randomized infants recruited from critically ill, term and late preterm infants diagnosed with cardiovascular insufficiency as defined by a need for inotrope therapy in the first 72 hours of age.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Investigators must adhere to the Neonatal Research Network Publication policies

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study was closed to enrollment after 12 participants due to slow recruitment.
